name: Ciprofloxacin Hydrochloride

indications.text: usage : ciprofloxacin ophthalmic solution 0.3 % indicated treatment infections caused susceptible strains designated microorganisms conditions listed : corneal ulcers : pseudomonas aeruginosa serratia marcescens * staphylococcus aureus staphylococcus epidermidis streptococcus pneumoniae streptococcus ( viridans group ) * conjunctivitis : haemophilus influenzae staphylococcus aureus staphylococcus epidermidis streptococcus pneumoniae * efficacy organism studied fewer 10 infections .

contraindications.text: corneal ulcers : recommended regimen treatment corneal ulcers two drops affected eye every 15 minutes first six hours two drops affected eye every 30 minutes remainder first day . second day , instill two drops affected eye hourly . third fourteenth day , place two drops affected eye every four hours . treatment may continued 14 days corneal re-epithelialization occurred . bacterial conjunctivitis : recommended regimen treatment bacterial conjunctivitis one two drops instilled conjunctival sac ( ) every two hours awake two days one two drops every four hours awake next five days .

warningsAndPrecautions: sterile ophthalmic solution alcon ’ drop-tainer ® dispensing system consisting natural low density polyethylene bottle dispensing plug tan polypropylene closure . tamper evidence provided shrink band around closure neck area package . ndc : 70518-1170-00 packaging : 1 1 carton , 5 ml 1 bottle plastic storage : store 2°c 25°c ( 36°f - 77°f ) . protect light . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: : history hypersensitivity ciprofloxacin component medication contraindication . history hypersensitivity quinolones may also contraindicate ciprofloxacin .
indications_original:
INDICATIONS AND USAGE: Ciprofloxacin ophthalmic solution 0.3% is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by susceptible strains of the designated microorganisms in the conditions listed below:
      

 
                  
                     Corneal Ulcers: 
                  
                  
                     Pseudomonas aeruginosa
                  
                  
                     Serratia marcescens*
      

 
                  
                     Staphylococcus aureus
                  
                  
                     Staphylococcus epidermidis
                  
                  
                     Streptococcus pneumoniae
                  
                  
                     Streptococcus (Viridans Group)*
      

 
                  
                     Conjunctivitis: 
                  
                  
                     Haemophilus influenzae
                  
                  
                     Staphylococcus aureus
                  
                  
                     Staphylococcus epidermidis
                  
                  
                     Streptococcus pneumoniae
                  
                  *Efficacy for this organism was studied in fewer than 10 infections.
contraindications_original:
Corneal Ulcers: The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of 
       
 
  corneal ulcers is two drops into the affected eye every 15 minutes for the first six hours and then two drops into the affected eye every 30 minutes for the remainder of the first day. On the second day, instill two drops in the affected eye hourly. On the third through the fourteenth day, place two drops in the affected eye every four hours. Treatment may be continued after 14 days if corneal re-epithelialization has not occurred.
      

 
                  
                     Bacterial Conjunctivitis: The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of 
       
 
  bacterial conjunctivitis is one or two drops instilled into the conjunctival sac(s) every two hours while awake for two days and one or two drops every four hours while awake for the next five days.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
As a sterile ophthalmic solution in Alcon’s DROP-TAINER 
  ® dispensing system consisting of a natural low density polyethylene bottle and dispensing plug and tan polypropylene closure. Tamper evidence is provided with a shrink band around the closure and neck area of the package.
 
                  
                  NDC: 70518-1170-00
                  PACKAGING: 1 in 1 CARTON, 5 mL in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC 
                  
                  
                     Storage: Store at 2°C to 25°C (36°F - 77°F). Protect from light.
 
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: CONTRAINDICATIONS: A history of hypersensitivity to ciprofloxacin or any other component of the medication is a contraindication to its use. A history of hypersensitivity to other quinolones may also contraindicate the use of ciprofloxacin.
